people.aboutText: Christina Judith Perri (born August 19, 1986) is an American singer and songwriter from Bucks County, Pennsylvania. Her debut single "Jar of Hearts" charted after it was featured on the Fox television show So You Think You Can Dance in 2010. The single went on to sell over 3 million copies in the United States and was a hit around the world.

people.name: Kirk Cousins
people.aboutText: Steven Adam Markowitz, known by his stage name Hoodie Allen, is an independent American hip hop recording artist. After graduating from the University of Pennsylvania, he began working at Google before ultimately quitting to pursue a music career full-time. Between the years 2009 and 2011, Hoodie released several mixtapes which garnered moderate success in the underground music scene.

people.name: Travis Tedford
people.aboutText: Reeva Rebecca Steenkamp (/ˈriːvə ˈstiːən.kʌmp/; 19 August 1983 – 14 February 2013) was a South African model. On Valentine's Day 2013, Steenkamp was murdered by her boyfriend, Oscar Pistorius, who said he believed she was an intruder hiding in the bathroom. Pistorius was later found guilty of culpable homicide at his trial the following year, and served a one-year prison sentence.

people.name: Veronica Roth
people.aboutText: Percy Romeo Miller, Jr. (born August 19, 1989), better known by his stage name Maserati Rome (formerly Lil' Romeo & Romeo) or his acting/business name Romeo Miller, is an American rapper, actor, basketball player, entrepreneur, and model. Miller is the son of well known rap mogul Master P. Miller has founded record label's Guttar Music, Take A Stand, The Next Generation & his current label No Limit Forever.

people.name: Romeo Miller
people.aboutText: Ella Guevara (born Janella Denise Yuson Guevara; August 19, 1998, Quezon City) is a Filipina child actress. She rose to fame through her appearance on a talent search on television called StarStruck Kids that aired on the Filipino television channel GMA 7.

people.name: Danny Galbraith
people.aboutText:
Joseph Michael Castanon (born August 19, 1997), better known by his stage name Sir Castanon, is an American child actor and pop singer-songwriter. He has appeared in several television series, including Jericho, NCIS, I Hate My 30's, Crossing Jordan, Shark, Without A Trace, October Road, ER, a mini series Comanche Moon, and won the 2006 Young Artist Award for Guest Starring Young Actor in a TV series for an appearance on Ghost Whisperer.
That same year, he made his feature film debut playing Ben Newman, son of Adam Sandler's character in the comedy Click.

people.name: Kristel Viigipuu
people.aboutText: Nathan Lopez (born Louie Nathanael Buado Lopez, August 19, 1991) is a Filipino film actor.

people.name: Nathan Lopez
people.aboutText: Daniel William "Danny" Galbraith (born 19 August 1990) is a Scottish professional footballer who plays as a winger for League Two club York City. Galbraith was a youth player with Heart of Midlothian and then signed for Manchester United, but injury problems prevented him from progressing into their first team. He signed for Hibernian in 2009, but left in January 2013.

people.name: Guadalupe Pérez Rojas
people.aboutText:
Kristel Viigipuu (born August 19, 1990) is an Estonian biathlete. She finished 18th in the 4×6 km relay and 83rd in the 7.5 km sprint at the 2010 Winter Olympics in Vancouver.
^ "Kristel Viigipuu, Biathlon".

people.name: Nafissatou Thiam
people.aboutText: Veronica Roth (born August 19, 1988) is an American novelist and short story writer known for her debut New York Times bestselling Divergent trilogy, consisting of Divergent, Insurgent, and Allegiant; and Four: A Divergent Collection. Divergent was the recipient of the Goodreads Favorite Book of 2011 and the 2012 winner for Best Young Adult Fantasy & Science Fiction.

people.name: Hsu Ching-wen
people.aboutText:
Hsu Ching-wen (Chinese: 徐竫雯; pinyin: Xú Jìng-wén; born 19 August 1996 in Kaohsiung) is a Taiwanese tennis player.
Hsu has won five singles and three doubles titles on the ITF tour in her career. On 14 September 2015, she reached her best singles ranking of world number 322.

people.name: Joseph Castanon
people.aboutText:
Nafissatou Thiam (born 19 August 1994) is a Belgian athlete, who broke the indoor junior world record on the women's pentathlon on 3 February 2013. This record could not be ratified, because the compulsory anti-doping control could not be organized in time.
Thiam, daughter of a Belgian mother and a Senegalese father, is a member of RFCL, an athletics club from Liège, and is coached by Roger Lespagnard.

people.name: Ella Guevara
people.aboutText:
Guadalupe Pérez Rojas (born 19 August 1994) is an Argentine tennis player.
Pérez Rojas has won six doubles titles on the ITF tour during her career. On 18 May 2015, she reached her best singles ranking of world number 410.
